clinical_study.brief_title: Observational Study to Evaluate Long-Term Outcome in Hip Arthroplasty
clinical_study.official_title: Multicentric Observational Study to Evaluate Long-Term Outcome, Performance, and Safety of Tornier's Implantable Devices in Hip Arthroplasty

brief_summary.textblock: This long-term outcomes study is designed to collect safety and efficacy data on designated, commercially available, Tornier hip arthroplasty products.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of long term outcome after hip arthroplasty with Tornier hip system products
primary_outcome.time_frame: At least 10 years and up to 20-year visits (+/- 1 year)
primary_outcome.description: Rate of implant revisions at each study follow-up time points after a total, hemi or revision hip arthroplasty

secondary_outcome.measure: Results and evolution of hip functional scores
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 3 months (+/- 1 month) ; 2.5-year visit (+/- 6 months) ; 6, 11, 15, 20-year visits (+/- 1 year)
secondary_outcome.description: Postel-Merle d'Aubigné (PMA) , Harris Hip (HHS) and Oxford 12 Hip Scores.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Continuous recording and specific questions at 3 months (+/- 1 month) ; 2.5-year visit (+/- 6 months) ; 6, 11, 15, 20-year visits (+/- 1 year)
secondary_outcome.description: Number, seriousness and relationship of adverse events reported as linked with implant use. Special attention will be paid to A.E. potentially linked with biocompatibility (Hypersensitivity, cutaneous reactions, etc…) and implant related noises

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 months (+/- 1 month) ; 2.5-year visit (+/- 6 months) ; 6, 11, 15, 20-year visits (+/- 1 year)
secondary_outcome.description: Number, intensity and localization of radiolucent lines, osteolysis and ectopic ossifications reported via radiological analysis.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 3 months (+/- 1 month) ; 2.5-year visit (+/- 6 months) ; 6, 11, 15, 20-year visits (+/- 1 year)
secondary_outcome.description: Results and evolution of the patient quality of life evaluation via EuroQol 5 dimensions, 5 levels (EQ-5D-5L) score.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 months (+/- 1 month) ; 2.5-year visit (+/- 6 months) ; 6, 11, 15, 20-year visits (+/- 1 year)
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of patient satisfaction following surgery

study_pop.textblock: Cohort of patients with a partial or total hip replacement (Tornier implants)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- man or woman >18,
- Indication of arthroplasty with Tornier hip devices, which are part of the study,
- the patient benefits from a health care system,
- the patient agreed for study participation.
Exclusion Criteria:
- existing tumor and, or particularly high surgical risk,
- anesthetic risk class IV or higher,
- subject is under guardianship and/or unable to follow procedures or matters related to the study. (Examples: Illiterate, recent psychotic or mania disorders and / or inability to comply with usual follow-up visits.),
- contraindications for arthroplasty with a hip Tornier device (see list of contraindications listed in the Instructions For Use (IFU) of the device(s)).
